title: Logic
description: Schema for a logic specification object. Logic objects represent formal or informal specifications used for preconditions (requires), postconditions (guarantees), safety rules, invariants, guards, and derivation policies. A logic object must have a description and may optionally include a formal notation and specification. If validation fails, verify 'description' is present and non-empty.

description.description: A human-readable description of the logic specification (e.g., 'Order total must be positive', 'User must be authenticated'). This is required and must be non-empty. If validation fails: ensure this is a string with at least one character.

notation.description: Optional formal notation system used for the specification. Currently the only supported value is 'tla_plus' (TLA+ notation). When present, the specification field should contain a formal expression in this notation. If validation fails: ensure this is exactly 'tla_plus'.

specification.description: Optional formal specification in the given notation. This is a machine-readable expression that formally defines the logic (e.g., 'self.total > 0', 'user.authenticated = TRUE'). Should only be present when notation is also specified.
